title: RADS Error, tried to fix , need help.
body:
My league has been working non stop for years now. Last night, I used Roguekiller to scan my computer for mal ware that I had. It took care  of my problem, however, now my league doesn't work. I;m not sure if it's a coincidence or not, but some time after that scan I can't use league. I'm not sure how they could be related. I looked at the files RK took away, and none had anything to do with league. When I start league ( have tried as an admin as well), I get the RADs error that the game can't connect. My internet is working fine and has been tested on multiple devices. I've tried going into the network settings and changing the DNS to 8 8 8 8, 8 8 4 4, as many other posts have stated. Most people who did that had their software fixed. I've tried changing the game to start as an admin as well, to no avail. I'd really like to play LoL and I feel the solution can't be too complicated, but I'm growing angry trying to do this on my own. Does anyone else have something I can try to get rid of the Rads error? I've also tried disabling windows firewall temporarily and then starting the game. No luck with that either. Any advice / ideas from people who have had this and fixed it would be GREATLY appreciated. Thanks,,

-MK (THE Marineknight)

replies.body: The error you're receiving can be a little misleading.  Your OS settings might be blocking the game from launching and can result in this error.  I suggest using our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to get this fixed and restore that access.  Hopefully, this will do the trick!
Restart your router turn it off then on again
I have tried this, as well as a cmd > ipconfig/release  xxxxx/renew. Anyone else? I've been googling through pages and what cures most peoples RADs error hasn't had any luck personally...

> [{quoted}](name=Marineknight,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=rOuR7mk7,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-09-23T07:32:46.382+0000)
>
> I have tried this, as well as a cmd > ipconfig/release  xxxxx/renew. Anyone else? I've been googling through pages and what cures most peoples RADs error hasn't had any luck personally...

Well most people that i told to do that actually had the problem fixed, i dont know how i can help you anymore sorry
I didn't mean to come off ungrateful for your response, am just getting frustrated. That's what seems unusual to me. Most people seem to be able to fix this issue easily, which I am not able to.

> [{quoted}](name=Marineknight,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=rOuR7mk7,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-23T07:36:03.471+0000)
>
> I didn't mean to come off ungrateful for your response, am just getting frustrated. That's what seems unusual to me. Most people seem to be able to fix this issue easily, which I am not able to.

Oh i didnt mean anything man Im just saying thats the only solution that i have XD
